intro: Rhynchospora macra, commonly known as the large-flowered spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant features dense, grass-like foliage with slender, cylindrical stems that bear clusters of small, pale green to reddish flowers. Rhynchospora macra typically grows in moist or aquatic environments such as marshes and pond edges. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of wetland ecosystems, supporting various wildlife species.
